column1: Seated at a dining table beside a tea set we see a woman
column2: 'LOG LADY' MARGARET LANTERMEN. In her arms she carries a wooden log. She is speaking to us.

column1: Welcome to Twin Peaks. My name is Margaret Lantermen. I live in Twin Peaks. I am known as the log lady. There is a story behind that. There are many stories in Twin Peaks. Some of them are sad
column2: some funny. Some are stories of madness
column3: of violence. Some are ordinary. Yet they all have about them a sense of mystery. The mystery of life
column4: sometimes the mystery of death. The mystery of the woods
column5: the woods surrounding Twin Peaks. To introduce this story let me just say it encompasses the all. It is beyond the fire. Though few would know that meaning. It is a story of many but it begins with one and I knew her. The one leading to the many is Laura Palmer. Laura is the one.

Through AUDREYS POV we FOCUS on the reflection from a mirror of BENJAMIN as he enters the room and closes the door behind himself.

column2: still seated
column3: is stunned.

column1: Through AUDREYS POV we FOCUS on the reflection from a mirror of BENJAMIN near the door to the room behind a deep reveal.
This is such stuff that dreams are made of.
Still viewing his reflection in the mirror
column2: BEN slowly walks into the room.

column1: As the last scene FADES OUT the next scene FADES IN. In a hallway of the hotel
column2: AGENT DALE COOPER walk up the hall toward his room. With his tie undone
column3: AGENT COOPER is carrying his tuxedo jacket in his left hand over his shoulder. In his right hand COOPER carries his mini tape recorder which he is talking into.

column2: 4:37 am. After a long investigative night
column3: returning to my room at the Great Northern. We have one suspect in custody and Leo Johnson
column4: the man I believe was responsible for Lauras death
column5: wont be able to escape the drag net weve thrown up for him much longer.

column1: AGENT COOPER pauses to listen and looks around.
As you can hear from the ambient sound around me ... and I notice with some relief
column2: that the Icelandic group staying on my floor have either checked or passed out. I may not need the Ear Pillow ear plugs. Which I did receive today Diane. Although I suspect I may put them to use as a purely precautionary measure. I ordered some hot milk from room service. Heres hoping that does the job and Ill be able to catch a few hours of quality sack time. Twenty-four hour room service must be one of the premiere achievements of modern civilization.

column1: COOPER turns off his mini tape recorder
column2: unlocks the door to his room
column3: opens it and enters.

column1: INT. DALE COOPERS HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT
Upon entering his hotel room COOPER spots a small envelope on the floor. COOPER picks up the envelope. COOPER smiles as he reads aloud who the envelope is addressed to.
The telephone RINGS. COOPER walks across the room to answer it.
Cooper here. (reply) Who is this? (reply) Could this wait till tomorrow morning?
There is a KNOCK at the door.
Please excuse me I got room service.
COOPER places the receiver beside the phone as he moves to answer the door. ANDY can be heard from the phone.

column2: Deputy Andy. Agent Cooper? We found Leo Johnson. Hes been shot. Agent Cooper?

column1: Through COOPERS POV the first thing he sees is a gun that DISCHARGES before he can do anything.
The gun is FIRED again and we see that the two shots have hit AGENT COOPER in the chest. The gun DISCHARGES one more time.
AGENT COOPER can be heard falling to the ground with a THUD.
We view LAURA PALMERS homecoming picture as the end credits roll.
